Title.En: Frugal building - from design to implementation

Description.En:
The challenge aims to **set up the key points in a frugal construction project**, from design to implementation.

It’s divided into **3 parts involving :**

1. studying documents and attending lectures on bioclimatic design, eco-materials and energy,
2. autonomous group work and in-depth study of a chosen topic,
3. concrete contact with the material through on-site participation in a school building site in west of France, producing a draft of a construction project.

---

The ECIU participants must sign up for the three phases of the project, and they will **work in teams** with **students from INSA Rennes**and **students from Brittany’s national architecture High School (ENSAB)**.

---

If you need more information, please contact the teachers : 

[Cecile.Holzner-Jacques@insa-rennes.fr](mailto:Cecile.Holzner-Jacques@insa-rennes.fr) 

[pascal.dupont@insa-rennes.fr](mailto:pascal.dupont@insa-rennes.fr)  

The module is supervised by a research professor of eco-design from INSA Rennes, and research professors in eco-materials, bioclimatic architecture, sustainable urban planning and home automation.

On-site, the students work with all the professionals involved in the project.

PrefLabel.En: minimise environmental impact on the surrounding area

Title.En: Make the link between the idea and the action through experience on the site

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
# **First phase of the project: Engage phase**

**Session 1, Week 16: Kick-off**

Project presentation, group building, ice-breakers

**Session 2, Week 18: Methodology session**

Working in multidisciplinary and intercultural groups

Reflection on users and the school project: what kind of school for tomorrow?

**Session 3, Week 19: thematic session**

Conference on bioclimatic building

**Session 4, Week 20: thematic session**

Conference on eco-materials

**Session 5, Week 21: thematic session**

Conference on energy

#   
   
**Second phase of the project: Investigate phase**

**Week 22-28 : Autonomous group work :** in-depth of a topic

**Session 6, Week 34: Group presentations**of content and expectations & Preparation of the workshop

#   
**Third phase of the project: Act phase**

**Week 35 - mobility from 26/08/2024 to 30/08/2024 :**  
Workshop at the school site in Rives-sur-Couesnon with an accommodation on site

---

#     
Teaching and Learning Activities:

##   
First phase:

Online sessions, studying documents and attending lectures on bioclimatic design, eco-materials and energy, thematic group work, interdisciplinary work  
Keeping a learning portfolio

##   
  
Second phase:

Investigate, autonomoust group work

##   
  
Third phase:

Taking part in the on-site workshop on a school building site.  
Keeping a learning portfolio  
Drafting of a programme specification booklet, with detailed arguments enabling the preparation of a draft stage of the building project, followed by the drafting of a Technical Specification.

## The assessment

will be based on the writing of the most precise programmatic specifications possible, with detailed arguments enabling the preparation of a draft stage of the building project, followed by the drafting of a Technical Specification.  
Progress and assessment will take the form of a portfolio during the workshop.
Would you like to take part in an eco-design project to build a school in Brittany, in the west of France?

This challenge is built on several recent experiences around Brittany (western France) sustainable building and the desire to oﬀer an introduction to this priority area of ecological transition in our region. 
    
We can offer you a concrete challenge to help you take part in a frugal construction project, from design to completion.

**Who?**

 Challenge aimed at undergraduate and graduate students (but possible application from researchers from all disciplines or continuous learners)

for students in the fields of construction, architecture and urban planning but also in materials, eco-design, home automation and other fields.

**How?**

To apply, please upload:

1. your Transcript of Records
2. a motivation letter
3. and a CV

**Mobility**: students should contact their university's International Office to apply for mobility support.

**And after applying ?**

You shall receive an e-mail to inform you if your application is approved: please check regularly your ECIU inbox (and spams!) to confirm your participation!
